UnitType.Backstory: Amzarin has killed as long as he can remember. He has nearly been killed many times as well, but it was always intellect that saved him. He has embraced this, and passed the ways of martial practice on to his tribe. Thus those who follow Amzarin win their battles. And with an empire behind him, Amzarin dreams of bringing the enlightenment of permanent war to Elemental.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You were never the strongest of Trogs. But you are a born fighter, and could never be content with any weakness. When you and your fellow warriors fought a group of men, their arrows wounded you and one of your strongest brothers fell.
Whenever possible, you studied the ways of men. And the ways of the Urxen, and the Quendar as well. You did not shun the bow and arrow - you trained in it. Magic began to heed your command. Thus you could kill before others could even reach their prey.
Now some see your true strength. They follow you, knowing where true might lies - in knowledge. And you are the mightiest mind of the Trogs.

UnitType.Quote: 'My blade hungers for the blood of man.'
UnitType.Backstory: "Feel no pain. Know no fear. Need no rest. Fight till the foe falls. Then seek the next battle." These are the watchwords of the yatra nata - the Juggernauts - the elite among all Trog warriors, soldiers segregated from their brethren on their eleventh name day for special training. History says their first battle came a dozen years after the Quendar conquered Teroth-Nu, when eight of them overthrew a city full of Magnar II's troops, and retook Kir-Tion's throne.

UnitType.Quote: 'I will break my enemy's spirits...then bones.'
UnitType.Backstory: These are Elemental's most fearsome warriors; bred for battle, taught to strike without mercy and to ignore pain, to banish the words 'caution' and 'surrender' from their vocabulary. Whether you engage them in single combat, or fight them in phalanxes, you will learn the truth of those words attributed to Iskahar, last of Ereog's line, as he lay dying on the steppes of Engar. "It is no shame to perish to a superior foe."

UnitType.Quote: 'Any invading force will dine upon my blade.'
